select1.label: Q01. Name of the surveyor

input.label: Q02. If other, enter your name here:
Q03. Enter the current date and time:
Q04. Record GPS location:
input.hint: Make sure the precision is less than 25 meters

select1.label: Q05. Phase
Q06. District
Q07. Site
You selected the site, in district, phase - is that correct?

input.label: If no, please enter the correct phase, district and site name below:
input.hint: Please use the following format (phase, district, site name)

group.label: Section C - End of construction survey of site

select1.label: Q10. Have the water minders been trained in aftercare?

input.label: Q11. How many households have access to water supply?

select1.label: Q12. Is the water supply currently functional?

input.label: Q13. How many male-headed households now have improved access to latrines?
Q14. How many female-headed households now have improved access to latrines?
Q15. How many child-headed households now have improved access to latrines?

select1.label: Q16. Has the VWHC met in the past month?
Q17. Does the VWHC collect tariffs for water supply for Operation and Maintenance and repairs?
Q18. Are the VWHC reports/books being kept up-to-date?
select1.hint: Please ask to see them, review them

select1.label: Q19. Have there been any conflicts related to water or sanitation in the community?

input.label: Q20. If yes, describe the problem:

select1.label: Q21. If yes, did the VWHC help resolve the problems?
Q22. Which gender occupied the chair position?
Q23. Which gender occupied the treasurer position?
Q24. Which gender occupied the secretary position?

input.label: In this section, please select three community members at random and ask them the following questions. When you are done entering the responses for one community member, you will be asked if you want to add results for an extra one. Say yes until you have all three sets of answers.

select1.label: Q25. What ways can faeces get into the mouth?
select1.hint: If village can give 2 good responses enter YES. Possible answers include: fingers, flies, fluids, fields, food.

select1.label: Q26. How can we prevent faeces from reaching the mouth?
select1.hint: If village can give 2 correct responses, say YES. Possible answers include: hand-washing, cover food/water, use VIP latrines, boil water.

select1.label: Q27. When is hand-washing critical?
select1.hint: If village can give 2 correct responses, say YES. Possible answers include: after using the latrine, after changing/cleaning a child, before preparing/eating food

select1.label: Q28. Are the hand washing facilities close to the latrines and with soap?
Q29. Is the water properly stored and protected at the household level?
Q30. What sicknesses can you get from unclean water?
select1.hint: If village can give 1 correct responses, say YES. Possible answers include: typhoid, diarrhea, stomach problems

select1.label: Q31. Where do you dispose of your child's faeces?
Q32. How do you keep your latrine hygienic?
select1.hint: Correct answer: the latrine should be cleaned regularly.

input.label: In this section, please select three households with a latrine at random and ask them the following questions. When you are done entered the responses for one household, you will be asked if you want to add results for an extra one. Say yes until you have all three sets of responses

select1.label: Q33. Do all the people in this household regularly use the latrine?
Q34. Is there a fly screen on the vent pipe?
Q35. Is the seat cover present in the VIP?
Q36. Is the VIP door intact?
Q37. Are there any flies in the VIP?
Q38. Is there odour in the VIP?
Q39. Has the latrine been cleaned recently? (is there no visible faecal matter and/or waste)
Q40. Is there a hand washing facility close to the latrine?
Q41. Is there a soap at the hand washing facility?

input.label: In this section, talk to at least one water minder that has been trained for this system and answer the following questions.

select1.label: Q42. Is the Water Minder (WM) familiar with the layout of the system?
Q43. Does the WM understand what are the functions of the system components?
select1.hint: Important: ask him to draw the system layout

select1.label: Q44. Does the WM know all the pipes and fittings used, their sizes and how to arrange and connect fittings correctly?
select1.hint: Important: ask him to show you an example with spares he has

select1.label: Q45. Does the WM know how to keep the tap stands and system equipment clean and hygienic?
Q46. Does the WM know how and to whom to report breakdowns?

input.label: Q47. How many breakdowns have been reported so far?

select1.label: Q48. Does the WM know how to carryout preventative maintenance?
Q49. Does the WM know how the pumping equipment works (if the system uses a pump) and how to operate it?
Q50. Does the WM know how to carryout minor repairs?
Q51. Does the WM have basic repair and equipment supplies?

input.label: Q52. Do you have any additional comments you would like to enter?
